Yesterday PA East Midlands went to Burrough Hill, a prominent ancient Iron Age hill fort in Leicestershire.This highly defendable location was built by our ancestors thousands of years ago; the ramparts are still formidable obstacles today. Photos don't really show the scale so we've added some artists impressions of what it would have looked like at its height.The site was in continuous use as a fort well into Roman times and was still used for social events such as dancing & games as late as the 16th century.We enjoyed a picnic in the shade, with local food, homemade cakes and homegrown fruit. Social events like these help bind the community together.
